title: Senior Software Engineer

jobsdetail.description:
Summary

Design and build the backend systems that power our fintech and payments platform. You’ll work with Node.js, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL to deliver scalable APIs that handle high-volume transactions securely and reliably. This role requires strong product awareness, deep technical expertise, and the ability to design solutions that balance performance, maintainability, and business impact. Blockchain and infrastructure experience (Kubernetes, AWS) are a plus.

What you’ll do
Build and operate backend services in Node.js/TypeScript with PostgreSQL at scale.
Design APIs that power financial transactions, ensuring idempotency, reliability, and developer-friendly integration.
Architect solutions for complex challenges across payments, ledgering, and reconciliation.
Lead feature delivery, from design through implementation, testing, and deployment.
Collaborate closely with product, design, and infra teams to align system design with business priorities.
Review code and mentor peers, raising the engineering bar across the team.
Investigate and resolve production issues with a focus on root cause prevention.

How you’ll work
Treat APIs and services as products, balancing developer experience with robustness.
Favor simplicity and clarity in architecture, while planning for scale and resilience.
Keep security and compliance top of mind in all technical decisions.
Document designs, runbooks, and decision records to enable knowledge sharing.
Collaborate openly in design reviews, code reviews, and incident postmortems.

Tools you’ll use
Node.js / TypeScript
NestJS (or similar backend frameworks)
PostgreSQL (plus caching/queueing as needed)
REST APIs
GitLab for version control and CI/CD
Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
Monitoring and observability tools (Datadog)
jobsdetail.requirement:
Minimum qualifications
5+ years of backend software engineering experience.
Strong expertise in Node.js, TypeScript, and relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred).
Proven experience building APIs that power financial or transactional systems.
Understanding of payments, fintech, or other transaction-heavy domains.
Experience designing for scalability, reliability, and fault tolerance.
Familiarity with distributed systems concepts (idempotency, concurrency, data integrity).
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across teams.

Nice to have
Experience with blockchain development (e.g., smart contracts, wallets, tokenization).
Infrastructure knowledge: Kubernetes, AWS, Terraform.
Exposure to event-driven architectures and real-time transaction systems.

title: Senior AI Systems Engineer (Rails + LLMs)

jobsdetail.description:
About Arist
Founded in 2019, Arist is transforming enterprise learning through AI-enabled microlearning. Backed by $16M in funding, we’re building cutting-edge tools that bring agentic AI workflows into the enterprise L&D world.
Website company:
https://www.linkedin.com/company/aristlearning/

Role Overview
We’re looking for an experienced AI Systems Engineer to design, build, and scale advanced AI-powered systems. You’ll combine your Rails expertise with deep knowledge of LLMs and ML infrastructure to deliver enterprise-grade solutions. From agentic workflows and multi-agent orchestration to RAG pipelines and voice-based learning agents—you’ll have ownership from day one.

What You’ll Do
Design and implement LLM-powered agentic workflows for real-world tasks.
Build organization-specific customization layers and AI safety systems.
Develop voice- and message-based AI learning agents.
Architect and maintain RAG, vector search, and evaluation pipelines.
Collaborate with founders, engineers, and clients to shape product direction.
jobsdetail.requirement:
5+ years ML experience (PyTorch, TensorFlow).
2+ years with LLMs (Hugging Face, OpenAI, Anthropic).
Expert Rails engineer (REST APIs, PostgreSQL, ActiveRecord, RSpec).
Proven track record building and deploying production AI systems.
Familiarity with LangChain / LlamaIndex (or ability to ramp quickly).
Strong communicator and collaborator, thrives in fast-moving environments.
jobsdetail.benefits:
✅ 401k Retirement Plan
✅ Health, Vision, Dental Insurance
✅ Founding-level ownership & growth opportunities

Keypoint:
1, 5+ years of Machine Learning experience (PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Can you describe a Machine Learning project you built using PyTorch or Tenso Flow in the past 5 years?
What was your role in that project (research, modeling, deployment…)?
2, 2+ years of experience with LLMs (Hugging Face, OpenAI, Anthropic)
Have you fine-tuned or deployed any LLMs (e.g., GPT, Claude, LLaMA)? Could you describe a specific use case?
With Hugging Face or OpenAI API, can you give an example of how you integrated it into a production system?
3,Expert-level Rails development experience
Have you developed any Rails applications that integrate with AI/ML pipelines?
At an expert level, how do you address scalability and performance challenges in Rails applications?
4, Proven experience building & deploying production AI systems (RAG, vector search)
Can you describe a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system you have deployed?
Which tools have you used for vector search (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus)?
5,Strong knowledge of AI Safety & Content Filtering
Have you ever designed a content moderation or AI safety filter mechanism for a product?
In your view, what are the best practices for deploying LLMs to minimize hallucinations and toxic outputs?

 Screening Questions
Please share a 2–3 minute video (screen share + voice) walking us through something you’ve built or worked on recently — ideally related to AI, LLMs, or system integration.
Describe a real-world AI system you’ve designed or deployed (e.g., LLM, RAG, multi-agent, or production ML system). What was your approach, and what were the biggest technical challenges you solved?

other: Ideal Candidate An innovative builder, strong team collaborator, and technically excellent engineer who thrives in ambiguity, learns frameworks fast, and wants to shape the future of AI in enterprise learning. Interview Process Intro Call (30 min) Technical Deep Dive (60–90 min) Practical Case Study Final Round with Founders

title: Center Manager/Site Supervisor
location: New Mexico ( Los Lunas, NM OR Albuquerque West/East)

jobsdetail.description:
Role Overview
We are seeking a Center Manager (Case Manager) to lead operations at a large national rehabilitation clinic. This role is responsible for overseeing daily clinic functions, ensuring high-quality patient care, and managing clinical and administrative teams. The Center Manager will drive workflow efficiency, maintain regulatory compliance, and foster a positive team culture. Additional responsibilities include optimizing clinic performance, mentoring staff, and developing training programs to enhance clinical excellence. This position offers leadership growth opportunities, performance-based incentives, and professional advancement within a well-established healthcare organization.
Responsibilities
The Center Manager/Site Supervisor will oversee daily operations, ensuring the center aligns with VibrantCare’s mission and strategic goals. This role requires strong leadership to drive team engagement, maintain compliance, oversee patient care, and ensure financial success.

Management & Operations
Foster a positive team environment to optimize retention and job satisfaction.
Manage employee relations, ensuring compliance with HR policies and procedures.
Develop and implement center-specific strategic plans, including marketing and sales efforts to increase referrals.
Oversee financial performance, including fiscal budgets, profitability, and expense management.
Maintain strong relationships with physicians, payers, and external stakeholders.
Supervise aide staff to ensure the highest quality customer service and efficient patient scheduling.
Ensure optimal caseload management and staff productivity.
Conduct staff orientation, training, and performance reviews.
Approve order requests and manage cost efficiencies.
Compliance & Quality Assurance
Ensure compliance with all state, federal, and company policies and regulations.
Maintain employee files, including licensure, certifications, and required medical documentation.
Participate in annual compliance meetings and quality improvement programs.
Conduct monthly staff meetings to educate and align teams with company updates.
Ensure center cleanliness, safety, and regulatory adherence.
Clinical & Patient Care
Adhere to state practice acts for physical therapy or occupational therapy services.
Provide direct patient care, including evaluations, treatments, and ongoing assessments.
Document treatment plans and patient progress.
Maintain open communication with patients, families, and referring physicians.
Stay updated on industry best practices and regulatory requirements.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications
Education & Licensure
Graduation from an accredited Physical Therapy (PT) or Occupational Therapy (OT) program (CAPTE accredited or equivalent for international candidates).
Active state licensure/registration where applicable.
Experience
Previous experience in physical therapy or occupational therapy settings.
Proven management or supervisory experience.
Strong understanding of healthcare compliance, financial management, and operational efficiency.
Technical Skills
Proficiency in Windows-based applications (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel).
Soft Skills
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and leadership abilities.
Strong time management and planning skills.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.
Exceptional judgment in patient care and team supervision.
Physical Requirements
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
Frequent walking, bending, standing, and reaching.
Strong visual and auditory abilities to communicate effectively and ensure patient safety.
Fine motor skills for accurate documentation and equipment handling.
Ideal Candidate Profile
The ideal Center Manager is a strong leader with experience managing outpatient rehabilitation clinics or healthcare facilities. They excel in team leadership, operational efficiency, and patient-centered care, ensuring smooth clinic operations while maintaining high-quality service.

This individual is organized, results-driven, and proactive, with the ability to optimize workflows, maintain compliance, and manage financial performance. They should have experience supervising clinical and administrative staff, fostering collaboration, and enhancing patient satisfaction and team engagement.

Strong communication and problem-solving skills are essential, along with a growth mindset and a commitment to professional development. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced healthcare environment, balancing leadership, financial oversight, and clinical excellence to drive success.

Retirement/401k

Vision Insurance

Up to $20,000 for relocation assistance, sign-on bonuses, and student loan assistance.
Continuing education reimbursement for professional development.
Work authorization and sponsorship support for eligible candidates.

Company-paid life insurance and long-term disability coverage.
Additional voluntary benefit plans.
401(k) retirement plan with employer contributions.

About company:

VibrantCare (https://vibrantcare.com/)

VibrantCare Rehabilitation has been a trusted provider of physical therapy services since 1974. The company focuses on delivering customized care plans that enable patients to return to work and daily activities in a safe, efficient manner. With expertise in manual therapy techniques, cutting-edge modalities, and advanced exercise prescription, VibrantCare aims to achieve optimal functional and clinical outcomes. They operate 51 outpatient and onsite rehabilitation centers across multiple states, including Arizona.

Message from CEO: “At VibrantCare Rehabilitation, we pride ourselves on fostering a culture of growth, mentorship, and resilience. We believe in doing the impossible and continuously pushing the boundaries of what’s achievable in physical therapy. Our leadership team is deeply committed to developing talent from within, offering structured mentorship programs, leadership training, and hands-on learning opportunities to help employees advance in their careers. Many of our leaders started as staff therapists and have grown into senior management roles through our internal development programs.

We function with the agility of a family-owned business while leveraging the stability and expertise of a larger healthcare organization. Every team member, from clinicians to administrative staff, is valued and recognized. Unlike larger corporate healthcare systems where employees may feel lost, at VibrantCare, leadership takes a personal interest in every clinician’s journey, ensuring they have the resources and support to thrive.

We emphasize teamwork, innovation, and continuous learning. Through our internal continuing education courses, industry-leading training programs, and collaborative team-building sessions, we create an environment where professionals can expand their expertise while fostering strong relationships with colleagues.

Our clinicians work side by side with leadership, rolling up their sleeves to make an impact, whether in patient care, program development, or community outreach. We also take pride in providing an alternative to corporate healthcare settings dominated by private equity, giving therapists the stability, security, and professional freedom to build long-term careers in an environment that prioritizes patient outcomes over profit margins.

At VibrantCare, we are more than a healthcare provider—we are a community of passionate professionals dedicated to transforming lives and redefining physical therapy standards.”

Culture
Growth-Oriented, Supportive, Innovative

title: VP of Business Development, LATAM- DFNS
location: Location: Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, or Miami (remote-first, office optional).

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Join a stellar team of leaders and experts in blockchain technology, cryptography, infrastructure, and security to build the backbone of blockchain wallet infrastructure for the next financial era. We’re hiring a VP of Business Development to spearhead our regional expansion and establish our company as the trusted partner for financial institutions and fintechs across Latin America. Reporting to the Head of Americas, you’ll own go-to-market in LATAM, driving revenue, building strategic partnerships, and guiding clients through the deployment of our wallet platform inside existing systems. This role blends strategic leadership with hands-on execution. You’ll prospect, qualify, and close high-value deals, while also working closely with product and engineering to ensure client success. You’ll bring credibility, comfort in technical conversations with engineers, and the resilience to grow in a fast-paced, resource-constrained environment.

Preferred experience
Responsibilities
Drive LATAM business development together with the Head of Americas.
Act as Dfns’ senior representative and local director in key markets.
Set and hit sales targets, grow revenue, and deliver ARR.
Build strong relationships with banks, enterprises, and regulators.
Source, qualify, and close high-value opportunities across the region.
Track market trends, watch competitors, and handle escalations across time zones.
Lead RFPs, RFIs, and negotiations for complex enterprise deals.
Support post-sale success: planning, compliance, and account expansion.
Review deal results to improve playbooks, targeting, and sales pitches.
Translate decks, speeches, and other content into Spanish and Portuguese.
Represent Dfns at industry events, conferences, and workshops.
Travel across LATAM to meet clients and prospects.
jobsdetail.requirement:

8+ years in business development and enterprise sales with leadership experience.
Proven track record of driving ARR growth and closing large-scale deals in finance.
Deep understanding of LATAM financial markets and regulatory environments.
Experience selling blockchain services or related financial technologies is a strong plus.
Strong business acumen, able to link technical capabilities to business value.
Skilled communicator, able to break down concepts for senior execs and tech teams.
Outstanding negotiation, presentation, and relationship-building skills.
Entrepreneurial mindset and resilience in fast-paced environments.
Proficiency with CRMs, automation platforms, and modern sales tools.
Fluent in Spanish and English; Portuguese is a strong plus.

Bonsol is the first Solana-native verifiable computation framework, enabling developers
to outsource complex computations off-chain while generating cryptographic proofs verifiable
on-chain.
With a suite of developer tools and a prover network, Bonsol allows builders to easily create
and deploy verifiable applications that directly integrate into a decentralized proof network.

● Shape our engineering culture
● Build the most performant, scalable, and decentralized computation network on
Solana

cutting-edge crypto infrastructure, we’d love to hear from you.

integrations and infrastructure platform.

request volumes.
● Support developer teams integrating Bonsol’s infrastructure into their applications.

practices.
● Continuously improve system architecture, security, and cryptographic capabilities.

title: Staff Backend Engineer - Daylight
location: NY preference but open to US remote

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Clicker is a protocol by Daylight, a USV- and 1kx-backed startup.
Problem
The core problem in trading is discovery: what should I buy and why?
Many people track other traders' trades to solve the “what”, but they never get the “why”.

Solution
Clicker is the global trade comment network: trade wherever, comment with why you made the trade, and see other traders’ trade comments.
Commenters and Clicker earn a % of the copytrades that comments drive across trading apps.
Apps get access to trade comments from traders in other apps and can give their users’ comments much greater reach than just their own app.

Why Now?

Trading apps like Coinbase Wallet and Phantom are going social (necessary foundation for Clicker).
CEXs (Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, etc) and fintechs (Robinhood) are all adding DEX trading to their CEX apps (huge TAM increase for Clicker).
New trading formats are getting traction: prediction markets, perps, tokenized stocks (huge content increase for Clicker).

How It Works
Trade in any app.
Comment on your trade in any integrated app (or in the Clicker mobile app in the beginning).
Earn on any copytrades your comments drive across Clicker-integrated apps.
Follow good traders and copy their trade comments.
Our mobile app lets you comment on all your trades (whether or not your preferred trading client has integrated Clicker), see the trade comments and trades of the addresses you follow, and discover good traders to follow.
We are looking for a staff backend engineer with deep experience designing and scaling REST APIs. Our API serves tens of thousands of requests per second, summarizing millions of rows of offchain data and terabytes of onchain data in 500ms or less.
The problems we work on are meat-and-potatoes software engineering: writing code understandable to others; optimizing Postgresql queries; tracing code paths for bottlenecks; getting the most out of AWS infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

Build clean, maintainable, and well-tested backend code
Collaborate with product to define, prioritize, and build
Design backend REST APIs for usability and for scale
Projects you may work on:
Feed: rapid, pre-built, algo-sorted feed of trades from people you follow
Discovery: surfacing good traders to follow across a diverse set of metrics
Trading Metrics: large scale onchain metrics (PnL, win rate, etc) aggregation
Trade Comments: prioritizing good comment creators across our products and partners
Protocol: improvements to the Clicker rewards contracts and indexers
Generally build the Clicker API - a robust, scalable, and developer-friendly API that the biggest crypto apps will use
jobsdetail.requirement:
You have:

Deep experience with modern backend technologies like Node.js, Typescript, AWS, and Postgres
5+ years at tech startups with millions of DAUs
Appetite to work on complex products with autonomy and creative freedom
Experience designing and building out programmatic APIs
Experience maintaining highly available infrastructure
jobsdetail.benefits:
💼 Compensation & Benefits
💰 Competitive salary with a generous equity package
🧑🏽‍⚕️ Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
🏝️ Flexible paid time off, supporting work-life balance

🧭 Interview Process
1️⃣ Hiring Manager Interview
A 30-minute introductory conversation to learn more about the role, Daylight, and your professional background.
2️⃣ Technical Interview
A 30-minute technical discussion to better understand your experience and what you’re looking for in your next role.
3️⃣ Technical Assignment
A practical assessment to see how you approach problem-solving. You can choose the format that best fits your schedule:
Sharing Git commits or previous project samples
Completing a two-hour take-home challenge
Or working on a short paid project over a few days

Hiring Criteria – Interview Questions
Do you have deep experience with Node.js, TypeScript, AWS, and Postgres?
Have you previously worked in a startup environment?
Can you share your experience in designing and building high-scale APIs?
Have you been responsible for maintaining highly available infrastructure?

Recruiting Tips
Will consider US based remote for exceptional candidates but they must be from a very impressive company with millions of DAUs.


Ideal Candidate
Staff-level backend engineer with deep Node.js/TypeScript, AWS, and Postgres, who has designed and run high-scale REST APIs (tens of thousands RPS, sub-500ms latency) and maintained highly available infrastructure. Proven startup track record: 5+ years at companies with millions of DAUs. Expert in Postgres query optimization, tracing/performance tuning, and large-scale offchain/onchain data aggregation. US-based preferred; remote only for exceptional candidates from top-tier, high-DAU companies.

About company:
About Daylight
The Daylight API powers the home tabs, explore tabs, and push notifications of the majority of the wallet apps in the industry (Coinbase Wallet, MetaMask, Zerion, OKX Web3 Wallet, and more) with personalized transaction recommendations: mints, claims, quests, dapps, swaps, and more. It’s “onchain for you” - like Netflix and Spotify’s home tabs, but with things to do onchain instead of movies or music.

location: Must be in the European Union (remote-first, office optional). France or Paris or as close as possible, always preferred.

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Join a stellar team of leaders and experts in blockchain technology, cryptography, infrastructure, and security to build the backbone of blockchain wallet infrastructure for the next financial era. We’re hiring a Head of People to own and lead all HR functions at Dfns. Reporting to the CEO, you’ll shape the full employee journey: hiring, onboarding, retention, offboarding, and culture. You’ll be our first dedicated HR lead, working closely with our Head of Administration and Legal Counsel, and ensuring the team grows, performs, and stays true to our values as we scale. This role is both strategic and hands-on. You’ll design policies, set up processes, and run programs to boost engagement, measure satisfaction, and foster a high-performance, security-minded culture. You’ll also oversee compensation, employee relations, and company-wide initiatives like retreats, workshops, and events.

Preferred experience
Responsibilities

Own the full HR lifecycle: hiring, onboarding, performance, and offboarding.

Help build and manage recruitment strategies to attract top talent across all teams.

Design onboarding programs that ensure new hires ramp quickly and feel connected.

Manage payroll, benefits administration, and employee records across regions.

Handle day-to-day HR operations: contracts, amendments, certificates, and compliance.

Oversee offboarding processes, exit interviews, equipment returns, and final payments.

Track and improve employee satisfaction, retention, and eNPS.

Organize company retreats, team offsites, and internal events to foster culture.

Partner with leadership to define compensation, benefits, and career development.

Support people with conflict resolution, employee relations, and policy questions.

Maintain compliance with labor laws, internal policies, and coordinate with legal.

Ensure HR systems, processes, and tools are up to date and running smoothly.

Promote a strong company culture built on transparency, collaboration, and trust.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Requirements

8+ years of HR or People Operations experience, including leadership roles.

Proven success building HR processes in fast-growing, international scale-ups.

Strong knowledge of hiring, onboarding, employee relations, payroll, and performance.

Experience driving employee engagement programs, including eNPS and retention.

Skilled in organizing retreats, offsites, and company-wide events.

Familiarity with EU and US labor laws; experience working in multiple regions is a plus.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence at all levels.

Organized, pragmatic, resourceful, and comfortable being a “one-person team” for HR.

Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.

location: Must be in the European Union (remote-first, office optional). France/ Paris or as close as possible, is always preferred.

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Join a stellar team of leaders and experts in blockchain technology, cryptography, infrastructure, and security to build the backbone of blockchain wallet infrastructure for the next financial era. Dfns is hiring a Trust & Compliance Officer to manage our security frameworks and global regulatory requirements. Reporting to the CISO, you’ll make sure Dfns meets the highest standards of trust, resilience, and compliance. You’ll run key frameworks (NIST, SOC 2, ISO 27001, ISO 22310, CCSS Level 3, etc.) and align our practices with financial and digital asset regulations worldwide (DORA, FISMA, MiCA, BVLA, and more). This role calls for both precision and adaptability. You’ll design and enforce compliance programs, lead audits, and act as the main point of contact for clients and regulators on trust and security. You’ll also work closely with product and security teams to integrate compliance into our workflows, and support clients in meeting their own regulatory obligations through Dfns’ infrastructure.

Preferred experience
Responsibilities

Manage compliance programs across multiple frameworks (NIST, SOC, ISO, etc.).

Monitor global regulatory requirements (FISMA, MiCA, BVLA, etc.), ensure readiness.

Coordinate internal and external audits, certifications, and assessments.

Develop and maintain policies, procedures, and docs to meet compliance obligations.

Partner with product to integrate compliance into architecture, operations, and features.

Serve as a point of contact for clients, regulators, and auditors on compliance matters.

Conduct risk assessments, recommend improvements to our security and trust posture.

Deliver internal training and promote a culture of security and compliance at Dfns.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Requirements

7+ years of experience in compliance, information security, and/or risk in finance.

Hands-on experience with compliance frameworks such as SOC 2, ISO 27001, NIST.

Strong understanding of global regulatory regimes including MiCA and GENIUS.

Proven success leading audits, managing certifications, and interacting with regulators.

Familiarity with PKI, cloud infrastructure and secure software development practices.

Excellent documentation, organizational, and communication skills.

Ability to work with tech and business teams, translating requirements into clear actions.

Certifications such as CISA, CISM, CRISC, or ISO Lead Auditor are a plus.

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Join a stellar team of leaders and experts in blockchain technology, cryptography, infrastructure, and security to build the backbone of blockchain wallet infrastructure for the next financial era. We’re hiring a VP of Solutions Engineering to help financial institutions and enterprises adopt our platform with confidence and ease. This high-impact role is both strategic and hands-on: you’ll design integrations for complex legacy systems, guide clients through deployment, and offer end-to-end technical support. You’ll pair deep technical expertise with strong client-facing skills, serving as an advisor to CTOs, architects, and engineering teams at banks, fintechs, and enterprises. You’ll design tailored solutions, deliver technical proposals, and drive adoption via troubleshooting, clear docs, and tight collaboration with engineering, security, and product. You’ll sit at the intersection of engineering and customer success, equally comfortable whiteboarding ideas, writing code examples, and jumping on late calls to help a customer.

Preferred experience
Responsibilities

Guide financial institutions through safe and seamless onboarding to our platform.

Architect secure, scalable deployment pathways that fit into legacy and modern systems.

Provide hands-on support: troubleshoot, fix, and build solutions alongside client teams.

Collaborate with sales to design technical proposals, demos, and RFP responses.

Maintain and improve technical docs and developer guides to industry standards.

Gather client feedback, analyze competitors, and turn insights into product tweaks.

Represent Dfns at conferences, workshops, and meetings as a technical thought leader.

This isn’t a narrow frontend role: you’ll be building web and mobile apps, refining SDKs, and designing interfaces that feel fast, intuitive, and trustworthy. You’ll move fluidly between polished user experiences and the developer tools that make them possible. We’re looking for someone with deep expertise in modern frameworks and cross-platform development, paired with strong UX instincts and a track record in fintech. You understand the craft of building business-grade software: noticing the details, moving quickly, and delivering with rigor. In this role, you’ll own features end to end, turning complex requirements into tools that make financial workflows effortless for developers, admins, and end users. Speed matters, but never at the expense of security, clean architecture, reliable performance, and clear docs.

Preferred experience
Responsibilities

Take full ownership of features, from idea to launch to iteration.

Build web and mobile apps for our Wallets-as-a-Service platform.

Develop SDKs and tools that make integrations simple.

Bring fintech-grade UX to blockchain wallets.

Design for clean architecture, speed, and security.

Work with product and design to shape and ship features fast.

Write clear docs, review code, and uphold high standards.

title: Forward Deployed Engineer – AI & Product (YC Startup)- Arist

jobsdetail.description:
About Arist

Arist is a YC-backed AI and microlearning startup revolutionizing enterprise learning and enablement. We deliver training, nudges, and communications directly via SMS, Slack, Teams, and WhatsApp—meeting employees where attention already lives.

Founded in 2019, Arist has raised $16M and is trusted by leading global organizations. Our mission: to build the AI-powered “push layer” for enterprise learning—bridging the gap between intent and action.

💼 The Role

As a Forward Deployed Engineer (AI & Product), you’ll work hands-on with clients to deploy production-grade AI systems that deliver real-world impact. You’ll bridge the gap between cutting-edge LLM technology and real customer workflows, working side-by-side with both client teams and Arist’s core engineers.

You will:

Partner directly with enterprise customers to understand workflows and design tailored AI solutions.

Implement and deploy agentic workflows using LLMs (OpenAI, Hugging Face, Anthropic).

Build and scale RAG pipelines, vector search, and evaluation loops in production.

Develop voice and chat-based AI agents to drive engagement.

Collaborate with product and engineering to translate field feedback into the roadmap.

Communicate clearly across technical and non-technical audiences.
jobsdetail.requirement:
🧠 Requirements

Must-Haves:

5+ years of experience in Machine Learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow).

2+ years of experience with LLMs (Hugging Face, OpenAI, Anthropic).

Proven track record deploying production AI systems (RAG, vector search, AI safety).

Strong communication and customer-facing collaboration experience.

Familiarity with Rails, REST APIs, PostgreSQL, ActiveRecord (nice to have).

Bonus:

Experience with LangChain, LlamaIndex, or related frameworks.

Product-oriented mindset and ability to thrive in lean, high-speed environments.

💬 Ideal Candidate

Innovative Builder: You design and deploy practical AI workflows that solve complex business problems.

Customer-Focused: You thrive in hands-on, field-facing work, iterating quickly with feedback.

Product-Minded: You bridge user needs with technical execution.

Fast Learner: You’re comfortable in ambiguity, shipping fast and learning faster.
jobsdetail.benefits:
🧩 Interview Process

Intro Call (30 min) – with recruiter or founder.

Technical Deep Dive (60–90 min) – on LLMs, AI system design, and Rails integration.

Practical Exercise – short case study or live coding (AI workflow).

Final Round (60 min) – with founders/team to assess culture and collaboration fit.

🎥 Screening Questions

Share a 2–3 minute video (screen share + voice) showing something you’ve built (AI, LLMs, or integrations).

Include a GitHub or portfolio link.

Are you comfortable building AI solutions hands-on with customers? Share an example or how you’d approach it.

(Note: This is a hard requirement; applications without a video will not be considered.)

💎 Benefits

401(k) Retirement Plan

Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance

Remote flexibility (US-based)

US citizens or valid US visa holders only.

👉 Apply now and be part of a YC-backed startup shaping the future of enterprise AI.

location: Preference for Europe/Dubai/UK but open to candidates based in EST time zones

jobsdetail.description:
About Nillion
https://nillion.com/
Nillion is a secure computation network that is redefining how high-value data is stored and utilized worldwide. While blockchain transactions were just the beginning, Nillion expands decentralized and privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs) into new frontiers such as AI, biometric data, healthcare, voting, and consumer data.

Backed by a $25M Seed Round at a $180M valuation (TechCrunch Q4-2022), Nillion boasts one of the most impressive founding teams in tech — including the Founding Engineer of Uber (Conrad Whelan), Founder of Indiegogo (Slava Rubin), Associate General Counsel of Coinbase (Lindsay Danas Cohen), and Co-Founder of Hedera Hashgraph (Andrew Masanto).

🚀 The Role

As Nillion’s Head of Community, you’ll play a pivotal role in designing and executing innovative community strategies that engage, educate, and inspire. You’ll lead initiatives such as ambassador programs, competitions, social campaigns, and community events, while collaborating closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams.

You’ll represent the voice of the Nillion community — hosting AMAs, workshops, hackathons, and live sessions — and shaping the culture that drives one of Web3’s most exciting ecosystems.

Location: Remote (Preference for EU & US East Coast time zones)
Travel: Occasional

🎯 Key Responsibilities

Develop and execute creative community growth and engagement strategies.

Launch and scale programs such as ambassador initiatives, competitions, and online events.

Partner with Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Developer Relations to align messaging and engagement goals.

Host AMAs, workshops, webinars, and Twitter Spaces to connect with the global community.

Monitor community sentiment, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to internal teams.

Manage and mentor a global team of ambassadors.

Handle community conflict and maintain a positive, inclusive culture.

We're looking for a Business Development Lead to drive payments partnerships. This is a high-impact role for someone who knows the payments landscape inside and out. jobsdetail.description:
What we're building:
Multi Asset Margin for Hyperliquid. Giving users the ability to post variable forms of collateral, instead of selling collateral for USDC and depositing to Hyperliquid. Multi asset margin comprises of over 86% of accounts in Crypto.

What is Hyperliquid.xyz: 
Hyperliquid is the fastest growing crypto derivatives exchange which is a 20-30B a year revenue sector. Currently around 6% of global market share. Hyperliquid has annualised revenues of over $1B in USDC, at 99% net margin.

https://www.theblock.co/post/368995/hyperliquids-revenue-all-time-high?utm_source=telegram1&utm_medium=social

How we're building it:
Blockchain under the hood, users will post collateral on our systems and we'll extend USDC collateral on venues of their choice. We will bring the venues to the user, as opposed to the user having to go to other venues. Users will be able to post various forms of collateral and eventually be able to trade on Hyperliquid without needing to sell down collateral. 

Join our Infrastructure & Platform team to shape scalable high performance systems and services. You will design and operate core components such as compute, storage and networking while working closely with the product team to deliver exceptional user experiences.

What you'll do

•Develop scripts and services that deliver speed and reliability in demanding, real-time environments.

•Deploy and manage compute resources and containers for custom services and integrations.

•Automate scaling, load balancing and congestion control across compute and database layers.

•Develop CI/CD pipelines for automated deployment, rollback and continuous delivery.

•Monitor system performance across CPU, memory, I/O and network, tune configurations for maximum throughput and resiliency.

•Build indexing and explorer services to enable live, fast and expressive data channels.

•Provision and optimize database systems for time series, relational SQL, key-value and in memory workloads.
jobsdetail.requirement:

•3+ years building production-grade infrastructure in cloud or on-prem environments.

Strong scripting skills in Rust and other low-level languages.

•Deep expertise managing compute instances directly (e.g. EC2 VMs) and/or container orchestrations (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes).

•Solid networking fundamentals: VPCs, subnets, load balancers, NAT, VPN, and network security.

•Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions) and infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation).

•Proven track record with time-series databases (e.g. TimescaleDB, InfluxDB) and key value stores (e.g. DynamoDB, Redis).

•Experience profiling and optimizing low-level system performance under high load.

•Authorized to work in the United States.

title: Head of Sales- Agora Finance

jobsdetail.description:
Description
At Agora, our mission is to transform how money moves. We believe stablecoins will underpin a new financial fabric, one that is faster, more global, and more efficient than today’s siloed systems. That is why we are building AUSD and the Agora stack, a full service platform that makes issuing, managing, and integrating stablecoins seamless – whether you’re a developer, fintech, or institution. With AUSD, stablecoins become programmable, composable, and ubiquitous by default.

We believe digital dollars should be a public good: trusted, accessible, and built for real-world utility. Our mission is to drive adoption through customizable, user-friendly on-ramps that make stable, dollar-based value available on-chain.

We’re backed by world-class investors including Paradigm and Dragonfly, and we’re growing a team to reimagine how value moves online.

We're intentional about who we bring on. If you’re passionate about stablecoins and want to help create more open, intuitive ways for people to engage with money, let’s talk.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We bring the discipline of high-performance finance teams and the creativity of a fast-moving crypto-native startup. We’re a small, mission-driven group of builders who move fast, sweat the details, and hold a high bar for excellence — in product, code, and culture.

You’ll be joining a tight-knit team that values clear thinking, extreme ownership, and high-velocity decision making. We operate in short feedback loops, support one another without ego, and are deeply motivated by the opportunity to build foundational infrastructure for the future of money.

JOB SUMMARY

We are seeking a Head of Sales to spearhead our go-to-market strategy and scale Agora’s presence across fintech, banking, corporate, payments, and crypto ecosystems. This is a true player-coach role: you will drive strategic enterprise deals and high-impact partnerships, while simultaneously  mentor and manage a high-performing sales and partnerships team.

Reporting to the CEO, you will define and execute a combined sales and partnership strategy by cultivating senior level relationships with decisionmakers at financial institutions, fintech platforms, exchanges, wallets, and infrastructure platforms. You’ll structure win-win collaborations, manage key accounts, and influence cross-functional alignment across the company to drive adoption and integration of AUSD and the Agora stack.
jobsdetail.requirement:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 

At least 5 years of experience leading or executing in the following domains:

Strategic Leadership

Defining and executing a go-to-market strategy targeting fintech, banking, corporate, and payments sectors.

Setting and exceeding ambitious revenue targets while maintaining pipeline health and accurate forecasting.

Designing scalable, data-driven sales processes for complex, multi-stakeholder enterprise deals.

Implementing top-tier pipeline management, forecasting, and performance analytics.

Team Management & Development

Recruiting, mentoring, and motivating a high-performing team experienced with financial institutions and fintechs.

Instilling a culture of accountability, consultative selling, and continuous growth.

Market Engagement & Collaboration

Building and nurturing senior-level relationships with leaders in fintechs, banks, corporates, and payments providers.

Partnering cross-functionally with marketing, product, and customer success to align messaging, pricing, and product-market fit.

Representing the company at industry conferences, events, and client engagements to enhance brand presence.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Hiring Criteria

Prior experience defining and executing a go-to-market strategy targeting fintech, banking, corporate, and payments sectors.

Experience designing scalable, data-driven sales processes for complex, multi-stakeholder enterprise deals.

Experience recruiting, mentoring, and motivating a high-performing team experienced with financial institutions and fintechs.

Experience working at a successful start up or scale up

Based in NY and happy to work hybrid

About Agora Finance
At Agora, we’re accelerating this transition. We’re building a global financial ecosystem enabled by this technology. One that advances financial access and opportunity, and reduces costs around sending and receiving money. We started with our flagship stablecoin, AUSD, and are building across the infrastructure and application layers to change the way the world transfers value.

Our team has deep roots in this space, and we’re looking for people who share in our mission to create a more inclusive and effective financial system. Come join us.

11-50

JOB SUMMARY

We are seeking an experienced Head of Risk to build and lead the development, implementation, and oversight of our organization’s risk function. The ideal candidate is a subject matter expert with strong leadership skills and deep knowledge of regulatory requirements in financial services, capable of aligning risk management with business objectives. The role will own the risk framework across reserve safety, liquidity, market/interest-rate, operational/technology, third-party, and regulatory risks unique to digital assets ensuring continuous alignment with regulatory requirements and best practices for safety, soundness, and consumer protection.

jobsdetail.benefits:
What is Hyli

Hyli is a next-generation base layer for a post-proof world. It’s an opinionated layer-1 blockchain built around the affordances of proofs. Hyli is built to unlock what proofs make possible: customizability, scalability, and privacy.

Hyli combines native proof verification embedded directly into the protocol with a fast data dissemination and data availability layer powered by the Autobahn consensus algorithm.

Computation must be verifiable, so we enshrined proof verification into the protocol and made it effortless to compose different proofs.

Proofs introduce latency and overhead, so we invented pipelined proving to remove this bottleneck.

The future runs on appchains, so everything on Hyli is an appchain by default: apps sequence on Hyli and update their state with a corresponding proof.

Hyli is:

Highly simple: no execution environment, no native runtime. Just proofs and data.

Highly efficient: leveraging the latest in consensus design (Autobahn) and proof systems (Risc0, SP1, Noir, etc.).

Highly usable: identity and access flows powered by existing user credentials (email, wallets, credentials) and signed data (passports).

Highly orange.

Fueled by a $3.4M investment from top-tier venture capitalists, our team is led by our founders Sylve (CEO) and Lancelot (CTO).

The team

We are currently a team of 8, including five developers.

You will work alongside the business team: Sylve (CEO), Cécile (Chief of Staff), Alex S. (Head of Content) and Matteo (Discovery team).

Interview Process
1,Hiring Manager Interview
2,Take Home Test
3,Technical Interview
4,Final Interview

Hiring Criteria

Min 2 years experience in a similar role

Early stage start up experience

Exceptional short-form writing

Crypto native with a deep understanding of Twitter culture and narratives

About Hyli
Hylé is the core layer for the modular ZK stack: a decentralised, censorship-resistant settlement layer for all proofs.
https://www.hyli.org/

About Deblock

https://deblock.com/en-FR

Deblock is a London-based fintech company founded in 2022 that's building a financial platform to bridge the gap between traditional banking and decentralized finance. Their core mission is to give users complete ownership and control of their money and digital assets through a secure, self-custodial approach. Unlike many traditional fintech or crypto apps, DeBlock is regulated by the ACPR (Banque de France) and the AMF (Financial Markets Authority), providing a high level of credibility and security.

What They Do
Deblock offers an integrated financial platform that combines the best of both traditional and decentralized finance. The service provides users with:

Non-Custodial Crypto Wallet: A multi-currency wallet that gives users full control over their private keys and digital assets.

Integrated Banking Services: Each account includes a European IBAN, a physical or virtual debit card, and instant SEPA transfers.

Seamless Crypto-to-Fiat Exchange: Users can easily convert cryptocurrencies to fiat and vice-versa directly within the app, which is a key differentiator from many traditional crypto exchanges.

Yield on Digital Assets: The platform provides opportunities to earn a competitive yield (up to 10%) on assets held in vaults.

Business Accounts: For businesses, DeBlock offers accounts with multi-signature wallets to enhance security and control over corporate funds.

The Team
The company was founded by a leadership team with deep experience in both traditional fintech and crypto:

Jean Meyer, CEO and Co-Founder (ex-Revolut Crypto Chief)

Aaron Beck, Co-Founder (ex-Revolut Payment Chief)

Mario Eguiliuz, Co-Founder (ex-Ledger Engineering Chief)

Adriana Restrepo, COO (Ex Revolut COO)

The team's background at major players like Revolut and Ledger highlights their expertise in building scalable, secure, and user-friendly financial products.

Funding
Deblock has successfully raised a total of $26.1 million in seed funding across several rounds. A significant portion of this funding, a $14.3 million round in November 2024, was led by prominent venture capital firms including Headline, Hoxton Ventures, and 20VC. This funding demonstrates strong investor confidence in Deblock's business model and vision.

Company Culture and Work Environment
Deblock is a dynamic and globally diverse company with over 60 employees from 12 different countries. They've built a culture that values flexibility and talent, offering a number of benefits:

Remote-First: The company operates on a 100% remote basis.

Flexibility: Employees have the option to work abroad for up to four months per year.

Generous Leave: The company provides 30 days of annual leave.

Competitive Compensation: Compensation is structured to be in the top 1% for the European market.

Additional Benefits: Private health insurance is provided for all employees.

Description
Lead Blockchain Payments Engineer - Fiat Ramps

Location: Full‑time, in‑person — London


We are Baton Corporation, a team of elite builders moving fast and redefining what's possible in the fintech and crypto space. As a high-growth software company, we are proud contributors to pump.fun, the largest crypto social network globally. We build for the future, driven by a philosophy of speed, ownership, and talent density.

As the Lead Blockchain Payments Engineer, you will be a core architect and owner of the essential financial infrastructure. You will design and scale the core services that power seamless fiat ↔ crypto flows, real-time risk decisions, and rock-solid financial records.

Key Responsibilities

Payment Orchestration & Integrations:

Own the end-to-end payment orchestration for major bank rails (ACH/RTP/FedNow/SEPA/Open Banking) and cards (including Apple Pay/Google Pay).

Design and implement idempotent, fault-tolerant APIs and robust webhook processing systems.

Integrate and manage third-party providers for connectivity (Plaid/TrueLayer/Tink), card processing (Stripe/Checkout.com/Adyen), and on-chain risk/compliance (Chainalysis/TRM, Travel Rule networks).

Real-Time Risk & Compliance:

Build and scale a real-time risk engine ($\le 300$ms) combining ML scores, rules, device signals, sanctions/KYC hits, payment intelligence, and blockchain analytics to yield fast GREEN/AMBER/RED outcomes.

Implement foundational KYC/AML primitives (CIP/CDD, sanctions/PEP screening, Travel Rule data plumbing) in close partnership with our Compliance team, ensuring audit-ready decision journaling.

Financial Integrity & Reconciliation:

Ship a double-entry ledger and automated reconciliation jobs that accurately tie together processors, bank statements, and on-chain balances.

Develop daily break detection and automated remediation workflows to maintain financial integrity.

Blockchain & Wallet Operations:

Ensure safe and rapid crypto delivery (e.g., USDC/SOL) to user wallets by managing hot-wallet flows, transaction creation, confirmations, and operational safeguards.

Reliability & Instrumentation:

Set the bar for reliability: implement SLOs, circuit breakers, retries/backoffs, dead-letter queues, shadow traffic, and canary releases for all high-risk financial flows.

Instrument everything with traces, metrics, and logs. Build internal ops & compliance dashboards and participate in the production on-call rotation for our 24/7 system.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Work closely with Product, Mobile, Compliance, Risk, and Finance teams, driving features from initial concept through production deployment and iteration.

jobsdetail.description:
Description
Gauntlet leads the field in quantitative research and optimization of DeFi economics. We manage market risk, optimize growth, and ensure economic safety for protocols facilitating most spot trading, borrowing, and lending activity across all of DeFi, protecting and optimizing the largest protocols and networks in the industry. As of April 2025, Gauntlet manages risk and incentives covering over $42 billion in customer TVL.

Gauntlet continually publishes cutting-edge research that informs our risk models, alerts, and analysis, and is among the most cited institution — including academic institutions — in terms of peer-reviewed papers addressing DeFi as a subject. We’re a Series B company with around 75 employees, operating remote-first with a home base in New York City.

Gauntlet’s mission is to drive adoption and understanding in the financial systems of the future. Building with decentralized systems creates novel challenges for mechanism designers, smart contract developers, and end-users of financial products, which are not seen in traditional software development and investing contexts. Gauntlet is dedicated to enhancing our industry’s understanding of this new domain and revealing how to safely navigate the true bleeding edge of 21st-century financial innovation.

Gauntlet App:

Join a newly formed product pod focused on the Gauntlet App — our next-generation dApp that allows users to deposit and withdraw into vaults directly. This role is part of a critical initiative to evolve our dashboard into a product directly connected to revenue. You'll be working on a high-impact project tightly aligned with Gauntlet’s core strategy, helping build a robust, user-facing experience at the heart of our business.

Responsibilities

Lead the design, development, and maintenance of full-stack features for Gauntlet’s decentralized application, ensuring high performance and scalability

Partner closely with front-end engineers to deliver cohesive and well-integrated user experiences

As a Backend Engineer, you’ll be directly working with the product team. In this fast-paced environment, you’ll be given complex banking and crypto problems to solve, develop and deploy. jobsdetail.benefits:
Recruiting Tips
The ideal candidate will have solid Kotlin experience and strong FinTech experience, ideally working within payments and SEPA.
They like to hire from reputable Web3 and FinTech companies.
Sweet spot for this role in terms of budget is $115k but will go up to $140k for top candidates.
This is an urgent hire.

About Deblock
Deblock is a London-based fintech company founded in 2022 that's building a financial platform to bridge the gap between traditional banking and decentralized finance. Their core mission is to give users complete ownership and control of their money and digital assets through a secure, self-custodial approach. Unlike many traditional fintech or crypto apps, DeBlock is regulated by the ACPR (Banque de France) and the AMF (Financial Markets Authority), providing a high level of credibility and security.

What They Do
Deblock offers an integrated financial platform that combines the best of both traditional and decentralized finance. The service provides users with:
Non-Custodial Crypto Wallet: A multi-currency wallet that gives users full control over their private keys and digital assets.
Integrated Banking Services: Each account includes a European IBAN, a physical or virtual debit card, and instant SEPA transfers.
Seamless Crypto-to-Fiat Exchange: Users can easily convert cryptocurrencies to fiat and vice-versa directly within the app, which is a key differentiator from many traditional crypto exchanges.
Yield on Digital Assets: The platform provides opportunities to earn a competitive yield (up to 10%) on assets held in vaults.
Business Accounts: For businesses, DeBlock offers accounts with multi-signature wallets to enhance security and control over corporate funds.

The Team
The company was founded by a leadership team with deep experience in both traditional fintech and crypto:
Jean Meyer, CEO and Co-Founder (ex-Revolut Crypto Chief)
Aaron Beck, Co-Founder (ex-Revolut Payment Chief)
Mario Eguiliuz, Co-Founder (ex-Ledger Engineering Chief)

The team's background at major players like Revolut and Ledger highlights their expertise in building scalable, secure, and user-friendly financial products.

Funding
Deblock has successfully raised a total of $26.1 million in seed funding across several rounds. A significant portion of this funding, a $14.3 million round in November 2024, was led by prominent venture capital firms including Headline, Hoxton Ventures, and 20VC. This funding demonstrates strong investor confidence in Deblock's business model and vision.

Company Culture and Work Environment
Deblock is a dynamic and globally diverse company with over 60 employees from 12 different countries. They've built a culture that values flexibility and talent, offering a number of benefits:
Remote-First: The company operates on a 100% remote basis.
Flexibility: Employees have the option to work abroad for up to four months per year.
Generous Leave: The company provides 30 days of annual leave.
Competitive Compensation: Compensation is structured to be in the top 1% for the European market.
Additional Benefits: Private health insurance is provided for all employees.

title: Data Scientist- Gauntlet
location: US, Canada and would consider candidates based in Puerto Rico

jobsdetail.description:
Gauntlet is the industry leader in quantitative research and optimization for DeFi economics. We manage market risk, accelerate protocol growth, and ensure economic safety for platforms that facilitate the majority of spot trading, borrowing, and lending activity across the entire DeFi ecosystem. Our work protects and optimizes the largest protocols and blockchain networks in the industry.

We also build institutional-grade DeFi vaults that deliver scalable, risk-adjusted on-chain yields — designed by some of the most rigorous quantitative minds in crypto and backed by years of research. As of April 2025, Gauntlet oversees risk and incentive programs supporting more than $42 billion in customer TVL.

Gauntlet publishes cutting-edge research that powers our risk models, alerts, and analyses, and we are among the most cited organizations — including academic institutions — in peer-reviewed DeFi research. We are a Series B company with roughly 75 employees, operating remote-first with a home base in New York City.

To expand our impact in the DeFi space, we are seeking experienced Data Scientists to help both new and established protocols better understand and optimize the systems they’ve built. This role requires strong analytical and interpretive capabilities, as well as the ability to collaborate with and manage external clients. You will work directly with leading, innovative DeFi protocols and develop deep expertise in the mechanisms that power the industry.

Responsibilities

  1. Conduct in-depth, novel research to improve the safety and efficiency of premier DeFi protocols through mechanism design, data analysis, and dynamic parameter optimization.
  2. Take full ownership of client engagements — including scoping work, managing relationships, and delivering impactful research and insights.
  3. Draft and publish high-quality research for public audiences to strengthen Gauntlet’s brand and fulfill client needs.
  4. Build and deploy clear, intuitive, and visually compelling dashboards for both internal and external stakeholders.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Qualifications

  1. 4+ years of professional experience.
  2. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to manage and support external clients effectively.
  3. Demonstrated ability to extract deep, actionable insights from complex datasets.
  4. Crypto-native with strong experience working in the Web3 ecosystem.
  5. Proficiency in data querying languages (e.g., SQL), scripting languages (e.g., Python), and/or statistical or mathematical tools (e.g., R).
  6. Ability to work autonomously and make progress toward abstract or open-ended goals.
  7. Experience with pricing models, financial products, and/or multiple asset classes.

Bonus Points

  1. Experience with derivatives-style products.
  2. Previous experience managing external client relationships.
  3. Published or presented research within the crypto, DeFi, or broader financial space.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Compensation & Package

We offer a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, On-Target Earnings (OTE) through cash bonuses, and equity refreshers in addition to the initial equity grant based on our Series B valuation.

Benefits & Perks

  1. Remote-first — work from anywhere in the US & Canada
  2. Competitive compensation with additional incentive-based earning opportunities
  3. Regular in-person company retreats and cross-country “office visit” perks
  4. 100% paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for employees
  5. Company-provided laptop
  6. $1,000 WFH setup stipend upon joining
  7. $100/month fitness expense reimbursement
  8. Monthly reimbursement for home internet, phone, and cellular data
  9. Unlimited vacation policy
  10. 12 weeks of fully paid parental leave
  11. Fertility support benefits

Interview Process

  1. Recruiter / HR Call
  2. Important: Candidates should thoroughly research Gauntlet before the call — including research publications, blog posts, forum communications, protocol partnerships, vault products, and recent updates. Gauntlet expects candidates to come fully prepared.
  3. Hiring Manager Interview
  4. Technical Interview
  5. Group Interview
  6. A 4–5 hour interview, possibly split across two days

Hiring Criteria

  1. 4+ years of professional experience, ideally including Web3 and FinTech exposure
  2. Exceptional communication and client-management skills
  3. Proven ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets
  4. Experience with SQL, Python, and/or statistical or mathematical tools (e.g., R)
  5. Experience with market-making or related financial activities

Recruiting Tips (Important!)

Gauntlet strongly prefers being introduced to candidates they have never engaged with before.

When screening, always verify whether the candidate has previously applied or interviewed with Gauntlet.

About Gauntlet

Institutional-grade vaults for decentralized finance

Gauntlet develops institutional-scale vaults that generate risk-adjusted DeFi yields. These strategies are powered by our automated risk platform, designed by leading quantitative experts in crypto. We continuously monitor market conditions to capture growth opportunities while protecting self-custodial capital and minimizing downside exposure.

Applied Research & Protocol Optimization

Our Applied Research team transforms cutting-edge DeFi research into actionable strategies that improve protocol efficiency, mitigate risk, and support sustainable ecosystem growth. Through rigorous data analysis, simulation modeling, and economic design principles, we help both early-stage networks and established ecosystems scale with confidence.

By combining deep expertise in cryptoeconomics, mechanism design, and traditional finance, Gauntlet delivers data-driven recommendations and systems that reduce systemic risk, enhance protocol stability, and accelerate long-term growth.

Resources

  1. About Gauntlet: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/about
  2. Open Positions: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/careers#open-roles
  3. Gauntlet Research: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/gauntlet-applied-research
  4. Gauntlet Blog: https://www.gauntlet.xyz/resources
  5. Gauntlet Vaults: https://vaultbook.gauntlet.xyz/

title: Core Dev- Seamless Protocol
location: Candidates must be located in an American timezone (this includes North and South America)

jobsdetail.description:
About Seamless

Seamless Protocol aims to simplify DeFi and make advanced yield opportunities accessible to anyone, anywhere. Guided by the vision of creating transparent and reliable DeFi experiences, Seamless transforms complex strategies into intuitive, one-click products for both individuals and institutions.

What We Build

  • Leverage Tokens – ERC-20 assets that integrate borrowing, swapping, and automated rebalancing, giving users amplified exposure without the burden of managing positions manually.
  • Seamless Vaults – Curated strategy vaults that automate liquidity deployment and risk management so capital is never idle.
  • Seamless Staking – Lock SEAM to earn protocol fees.
  • Seamless Governance – Community-driven decision-making that guides product launches, risk parameters, and treasury growth.
  • Why Work With Us
  • Category Ownership – We're defining the next generation of DeFi primitives—packaged leverage—on Base and beyond. Your code will reach hundreds of thousands of wallets and manage nine-figure TVL from day one.
  • High Impact & Autonomy – Small, senior-heavy squads own problems end-to-end. From ideation to governance proposal to mainnet deployment, your work ships fast.
  • Open-Source & Community-First – All core smart contracts are public, auditable, and built for composability.
  • Sustainable Incentives – Revenue flows back to contributors through Seamless Staking, aligning long-term protocol health with SEAM holders.

Our Culture

  • Clarity Over Complexity – Whether it's UI or Solidity, we prioritize simplicity and user focus.
  • Bias for Shipping – Deliver iteratively; perfect is the enemy of good.
  • Ownership at Every Level – When you see a gap, you take action.

Role Summary – Core Developer

  • Core Developers at Seamless Protocol serve the DAO and community by contributing across the stack to drive the protocol forward. They bring:
  • Deep DeFi knowledge and extensive smart contract development experience.
  • Strong computer science fundamentals and up-to-date blockchain expertise.
  • A proactive mindset, anticipating challenges and designing innovative solutions.
  • Clear communication skills and the ability to collaborate with engineers, PMs, and designers to prioritize and implement new features.
  • A commitment to building secure, efficient, and user-friendly products aligned with Seamless’s mission.
  • With strong technical skills and a high sense of ownership, Core Developers play a crucial role in shaping the future of DeFi and sustaining Seamless’s growth in a rapidly evolving blockchain ecosystem.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain data pipelines, backend services, and frontend interfaces that support core protocol functionality.
  • Collaborate with core contributors and community members to define, scope, and prioritize new protocol features and enhancements.
  • Produce clear, comprehensive documentation for smart contracts, backend systems, data queries, and frontend integrations.
  • Assist community members in creating on-chain payloads for governance proposals submitted to the DAO.
  • Conduct rigorous testing and perform internal audits to ensure the protocol’s security, stability, and reliability.
  • Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and best practices in DeFi, blockchain engineering, and smart contract development.
  • Work closely with the Seamless community across Discord, Discourse, and GitHub to support development efforts and coordinate improvements.
  • Design and implement core smart contracts for the Seamless DeFi protocol using Solidity.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Qualifications

  • Deep understanding of DeFi concepts, protocols, and the broader ecosystem.
  • Experience with backend development using Node.js, Go, or similar technologies.
  • Experience with frontend development using React.js.
  • Hands-on experience with blockchain data tools such as The Graph, Dune, etc.
  • Familiarity with foundational DeFi protocols (e.g., Uniswap, Compound, Aave).
  • Familiarity with blockchain development frameworks and libraries such as Foundry, OpenZeppelin, and related tooling.
  • Working knowledge of Solidity and experience interacting with on-chain protocols.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and strong critical thinking skills, especially when dealing with complex, interconnected systems.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with a distributed, global team.
  • Passion for DeFi and a commitment to building transparent, secure, and user-friendly products.
  • Experience working in small, agile teams or startup-like environments.

Location

  • Candidates must be based in a North American time zone.

Interview Process

  • Hiring Manager Interview – 15–30 minutes
  • Technical Interview – 1 hour
  • Technical Interview – 1 hour
  • Behavioral Interview – 45 minutes

Hiring Criteria

  • Strong understanding of DeFi concepts, protocols, and ecosystem dynamics.
  • Experience in both backend and frontend development using Node.js, Go, React.js, or equivalent technologies
  • (e.g., Rust for backend, Angular for frontend is also acceptable).

title: Solidity Smart Contract Engineer -Multiliquid
location: US only (preference for onsite/hybrid in LA)

jobsdetail.description:
Description

About Uniform Labs


We are an on-chain financial infrastructure company backed by leading VCs including Strobe Fund, CMT Digital, Metalayer VC, The Venture Dept, and Generative Ventures. We're upgrading financial markets through 24/7 instant settlement. Our first product is Multiliquid, an institutional-grade smart contract protocol that facilitates interoperability and liquidity across tokenized financial assets and stablecoins. Our mission is to bridge traditional finance (TradFi) assets and decentralised finance (DeFi) in a transparent, efficient, and highly scalable way, ultimately replatforming all of financial markets on 10x better infrastructure in the form of blockchain.


Role Overview


We're looking for a Smart Contract Developer to join our core engineering team. In this hands-on role, you'll design, develop, and deploy secure smart contracts that power the Multiliquid protocol. You'll architect on-chain logic, optimize gas efficiency, ensure security best practices, and build the foundational infrastructure that enables institutional-grade DeFi operations. This is an opportunity to shape the core protocol layer of institutional DeFi, building robust, auditable smart contracts that handle significant liquidity flows across multiple chains.


You will work on a small, rigorously selected, senior team of engineers. You will be responsible for collaborating closely with product, compliance, security auditors, and business stakeholders. This is a high-impact role requiring deep technical expertise in blockchain development, strong security mindset, strategic thinking, and a passion for delivering best-in-class DeFi solutions.


Key Responsibilities

Smart Contract Development

Design, develop, test, and deploy secure smart contracts in Solidity for the Multiliquid protocol using Foundry.

Implement complex DeFi primitives including liquidity pools, cross-chain bridges, access control mechanisms, and institutional-grade financial logic.

Write clean, well-documented, gas-optimized code that adheres to industry best practices and established design patterns.


Protocol Architecture

Architect scalable, modular smart contract systems that support evolving protocol requirements.

Design upgradeable contract patterns and governance mechanisms for protocol evolution.

Collaborate with the engineering team to define on-chain/off-chain boundaries and integration points.


Security & Auditing

Conduct thorough internal security reviews and testing of smart contracts before deployment.

Work closely with external auditors to address findings and implement recommended security improvements.

Proactively identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities, attack vectors, and edge cases.

Stay current with emerging security threats and best practices in the DeFi ecosystem.


Testing & Quality Assurance

Write comprehensive unit tests, integration tests, and fuzzing tests for all smart contract code.

Develop test suites that cover edge cases, failure scenarios, and adversarial conditions.

Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to maintain high code quality standards.


Cross-Chain & Integration Work

Implement cross-chain messaging protocols and bridge integrations to enable multi-chain liquidity flows.

Collaborate with full-stack engineers to ensure seamless integration between smart contracts and front-end/back-end systems.

Design and document contract interfaces (ABIs) that enable efficient off-chain interaction.


Hands-On Engineering

Actively write and deploy smart contract code to mainnet and testnets.

Lead the development of core protocol features and upgrades.

Monitor deployed contracts, respond to on-chain events, and troubleshoot issues in production environments.

Prototype, iterate, and optimize rapidly in a fast-moving environment.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Why Join Us?

Impact: Help shape the user experience and interface of the future liquidity layer for tokenized finance.

Innovation: Work on real-world blockchain integrations powering institutional-grade capital flows.

Learning: Expand your understanding of DeFi, tokenized assets, and decentralized infrastructure.

Team: Join a collaborative, mission-driven team backed by top investors.

Upside: Competitive salary, equity upside, and the chance to be an early builder of a transformative protocol.


Compensation & Package

Base Salary + Equity

Interview Process

1.Founder / CEO Interview

2.Founder / CEO Interview

3.Technical Interview

4.Final Interview

Our first product is Multiliquid, an institutional-grade smart contract protocol that facilitates interoperability and liquidity across tokenized financial assets and stablecoins. title: Senior Backend Engineer-M0

jobsdetail.description:
M0 is a stablecoin platform for builders. With M0, developers can create their stablecoins in minutes by extending $M - M0’s superior digital-dollar building block, and customize attributes such as branding, compliance behaviors, and yield distribution mechanics. By extending $M into their own stablecoin, businesses can monetize their digital dollar use cases and maintain control over their money tech stack, while not being burdened by operational heavy-lifting.


M0 is seeking an experienced Protocol Backend Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will enhance the growing set of $M Extensions projects, support partners' technical teams, improve existing products, and create and maintain comprehensive documentation.


Key Responsibilities:

  1. ​​Design and develop automated onchain minting and cross-chain stablecoin liquidity management solutions.
  2. Deploy modern web applications using best practices to ensure security, compliance, security, and high availability.
  3. Implement monitoring and alerting systems to deliver high-uptime, low-latency user experiences.
  4. Mentor mid-level engineers, conduct code reviews, and foster a culture of knowledge sharing and best practices.
  5. Promote engineering excellence and agile practices to deliver projects on schedule and within budget.

About M0

M0 is a universal stablecoin platform. With M0, builders can create their own stablecoins by using M0’s platform, and customize attributes such as branding, compliance behaviors, and yield distribution mechanics. By leveraging M0, businesses can monetize their digital dollar use cases and maintain control over their money tech stack, while not being burdened by operational heavy-lifting.

Unlike traditional stablecoin models, M0 is built as an open multi-issuer framework that delivers seamless interoperability between $M and its extensions, but also allows builders of custom stablecoins to upgrade into their own issuers and not depend on anyone else for issuance.

M0 redefines the stablecoin landscape by eliminating traditional barriers to issuance, enabling an open and composable financial ecosystem where businesses and developers can create, customize, and scale their digital dollar solutions with unmatched flexibility. As a neutral and transparent protocol, M0 ensures that stablecoin liquidity remains fluid, accessible, and optimized for efficiency—laying the groundwork for a more decentralized and resilient financial system.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Onramp ( BATON CORP)

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Location: New York, NY (Full-Time, In-Person)

Company: Baton Corporation


Who We Are


We’re Baton Corporation, a team of elite builders moving fast and redefining what’s possible.

We’re a high-growth software company and proud contributors to pump.fun, the world’s largest crypto social network. We build for the future.


What You’ll Do


As a Backend Engineer, you’ll design and scale the fintech and crypto systems powering seamless fiat ↔ crypto flows, real-time risk decisions, and rock-solid financial records.


You will:


  1. Own payment orchestration for bank rails (ACH, RTP, FedNow, SEPA, Open Banking) and cards (Apple Pay, Google Pay) with idempotent, fault-tolerant APIs and webhook processing.
  2. Integrate third-party providers (Plaid, TrueLayer, Tink, Stripe, Checkout.com, Adyen, Chainalysis, TRM, Travel Rule networks) behind clean, reliable interfaces.
  3. Build a real-time risk engine (<300ms) combining rules, ML scores, device signals, sanctions/KYC hits, and blockchain analytics to drive GREEN/AMBER/RED outcomes.
  4. Implement KYC/AML primitives (CIP/CDD, sanctions/PEP screening, Travel Rule data, audit-ready journaling) in close partnership with Compliance.
  5. Ship a double-entry ledger and reconciliation system tying together processors, bank statements, and on-chain balances with daily break detection and automated remediation.
  6. Deliver crypto to user wallets safely and fast (e.g., USDC/SOL), managing hot-wallet flow, transaction creation, confirmations, and operational safeguards.
  7. Raise the bar on reliability — SLOs, circuit breakers, retries, DLQs, shadow traffic, and canary releases.
  8. Instrument everything with traces, metrics, and logs. Build internal ops & compliance dashboards and participate in on-call for a 24/7 system.
  9. Collaborate cross-functionally with product, mobile, compliance, risk, and finance to take features from concept to production.
jobsdetail.benefits:
Why Join Us


If you thrive in chaos, love ambitious problems, and want to build something game-changing, we want to hear from you.


At our core, we believe in:

  1. ⚡ Speed over perfection — ship now, iterate later.
  2. 🧠 Ownership over bureaucracy — everyone makes big decisions.
  3. 💎 Talent density over headcount — we hire the best, no exceptions.
  4. 🌍 Building for the future — crypto moves fast, and so do we.
