title: Product Lead (Morpho Prime) -Morpho Labs

jobsdetail.description:
Description

Morpho is a leading Decentralized Finance (DeFi) lending protocol that recently secured $50 million in funding from Ribbit Capital, a16z crypto, Coinbase Ventures, Variant, Brevan Howard, Pantera, Blocktower, and 50 others to support its mission of revolutionizing lending with an open, efficient, and resilient platform. Morpho is experiencing explosive growth, with over $9 billion in assets supplied on the protocol, solidifying itself as the new standard for DeFi lending. Now, Morpho is scaling its team of contributors to establish itself as a cornerstone, not just of DeFi, but of a new internet-native financial system.


Location

Paris or remote (from GMT -5 up to GMT +2 to ensure sufficient overlap with the rest of the team).


Mission & Responsibilities

We’re looking for a Product Lead to drive Morpho’s Prime Products vertical.


You’ll work with engineering, design, data and protocol teams to set strategy, ship industry-shaping products and help Curators and Advanced Users interact with Morpho’s protocol.

To do so, you will need to develop a deep understanding of Morpho’s protocol and products, various stakeholders, the market, competitors and the wider Defi and lending industry as a whole.


Specifically, you will:

Understand Morpho’s various stakeholders, their needs and requirements,

Deeply understand the wider crypto lending space, both Centralized and Decentralized,

Execute on the product vision and strategy with a world-class engineering team,

Shape the products that Curators, Institutions and Pro users use to manage risk and exposure.
jobsdetail.requirement:
Must-have Experience & Skills

Job requirements

5+ years of experience building and shipping products in the Crypto Lending or Trading space,

Understanding of technical web development fundamentals (APIs, SDKs…),

Understanding of Risk Management and trade execution in crypto and DeFi,

Experience working with large institutions, funds or capital allocators in Defi or Finance,

Experience working directly with Engineering teams to deliver 0-to-1 products,

Exceptional organization and communication skills,

Low-ego, high-ownership mindset.

(Optional – cover note)


About Morpho Labs

Overview and Mission

Morpho Labs is the development company behind Morpho, a leading decentralized lending protocol. Its mission is to make financial infrastructure a public good by providing an open, efficient, and resilient platform for on-chain loans. Morpho enables anyone to earn yield or borrow crypto assets permissionlessly, while also allowing developers and businesses to build custom lending markets and vaults on its infrastructure.


Since launch, Morpho has grown into one of the largest DeFi lending systems (≈$6 B in deposits as of mid-2025) operating on Ethereum and other chains. Its vision is to become a cornerstone of a new internet-native financial system by fusing DeFi lending with traditional fintech.


Product Offerings

Morpho offers a suite of lending/borrowing products and developer tools built around its smart-contract protocol:


Consumer Products (Earn/Borrow):

Retail users can deposit assets into Morpho Vaults to earn optimized interest, or post collateral to borrow other tokens. Morpho optimizes yields by peer-to-peer matching within its vaults on top of base pools like Aave/Compound. Borrowers enjoy higher collateral limits and no protocol fees.


Curate/Vaults (Prime):

Power users and institutions can deploy custom vaults and lending markets. The Curate interface lets “vault curators” configure collateral types, interest models, and risk parameters, earning fees for supplying liquidity. These vaults are open, customizable, and scalable, benefiting from Morpho’s liquidity and matching engine. This is powered by the “Morpho Blue” protocol — a minimal core lending engine designed for security and flexibility.


Developer Tools (Infra):

Morpho provides on-chain and off-chain infrastructure for developers. A public GraphQL API and SDK libraries let applications query Morpho data and integrate lending functions. Enterprises can build their own lending use cases on Morpho’s stack, benefitting from audited, formally-verified contracts and DevOps tools.


Morpho infrastructure underpins notable integrations — for example, Coinbase’s on-chain lending launched in early 2025 uses Morpho on the Base chain to offer crypto-backed loans through the Coinbase app.


Funding History

Morpho Labs has raised approximately $70 M in venture funding (mostly through token sales):

Seed Round (Oct 2021): ~$1.35 M, led by Semantic Ventures and Nascent

Strategic Round (July 2022): $18 M, co-led by a16z Crypto and Variant

Strategic Round (Aug 2024): $50 M, led by Ribbit Capital with a16z, Coinbase Ventures, Pantera, Brevan Howard, BlockTower, Kraken Ventures, and others

These funds are supporting growth on Ethereum and expansion to new chains.


Team Structure and Leadership

Morpho Labs is structured with both for-profit and nonprofit entities, but engineering is centralized under the development company.

The engineering organization is divided into smart-contract and off-chain teams. Core protocol development is handled by a small group focused on Morpho Blue, vaults, and oracles. A separate infrastructure/API team manages backend services and the public API. The Head of Engineering will lead this off-chain group and help scale engineering practices.


Technology Stack and Culture

Morpho emphasizes security, minimalism, and modern DevOps:

On-chain: Solidity (Morpho Blue is ~600 LOC), fully audited, formally verified, $2.5M bug bounty

Off-chain: TypeScript (Node.js), Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, GraphQL API

Dev Culture: Research-driven, collaborative, with open discussion and weekly “DeFi School” sessions

Engineers are encouraged to deeply threat-model and simplify systems. Most work is remote-friendly with periodic in-person bootcamps.

Recent Updates (Past 12 Months)

Corporate Restructuring: Morpho Labs SAS merged into the Morpho Association nonprofit; all equity transferred to the DAO.

Coinbase Partnership: Coinbase launched on-chain lending powered by Morpho on Base.

Token Unlock: MORPHO governance token became transferable in late 2024.

Growth: Deposits have scaled to ~$6 B; ongoing protocol upgrades and mobile features released.


Open Source and Community Contributions

Morpho’s contracts and tools are open source under a dual license. The GitHub organization hosts:

Morpho Blue (core protocol)

Vaults, oracles, and rewards contracts

TypeScript SDKs for integration

Developer documentation and tooling

They also regularly publish lending protocol research and offer one of the largest bug bounties in DeFi.

Locations and Remote Policy


Morpho Labs is based in Paris, with a remote-friendly culture. Team members work across Europe and North America (GMT-5 to GMT+2 time zones). Roles are open to remote engineers with occasional meetups at the Paris HQ.


Resources

Description

About Sei

Sei Labs builds open sourced technology for the high-performance Sei Blockchain, the first parallelized EVM Layer 1 blockchain designed to scale with the industry. The unique optimizations built into Sei enable Web3 applications to reach Web2 level scale and performance, driving the mass adoption of digital assets.


Our teams are comprised of former Google, Goldman Sachs, Robinhood, Nvidia, and Databricks veterans dedicated to onboarding the next billion users onto a vibrant ecosystem of applications.


Sei Labs has raised over $30M from top investors including Jump Crypto, Multicoin Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Distributed Global, Hudson River Trading, and Flow Traders.

● Phối hợp với đội Sales trong giai đoạn tiền bán hàng của các dự án.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Execution Team- Hashgraph

jobsdetail.description:
About Hashgraph:


Hashgraph is a fast-growing software company committed to supporting, developing and servicing Hedera, an open source, proof-of-stake platform. Hedera is EVM-compatible and has been specifically built to meet the needs of enterprise and Web3 applications, which require speed, security, stability and sustainability. Hedera’s public network is governed by industry-leading organizations, spanning 11 sectors and 14 regions who oversee the development and direction of the decentralised platform.


About The Team:


The Execution Team is one of the core teams that builds and maintains the Hiero Consensus Node, the heart of the Hiero Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT). Our team is responsible for delivering the Hiero native services, which include the Crypto, Token, Consensus, and File Services. We also own transaction processing, fee collection, rewards accounting, and distribution. Furthermore, the generation of records and blocks is part of our responsibility. Our team works primarily in Java, and our code is open source. We collaborate closely with internal and external partners to deliver a reliable, performant, scalable, secure, fault-tolerant, and developer-friendly platform.


About the role:


As a Staff Software Engineer, you’ll be a technical leader on the Execution Team, responsible for delivering software services, business logic, and APIs within the Hiero Consensus Node. You’ll work on deeply technical challenges involving distributed execution, state management, transaction lifecycles, and economic systems (fees, rewards, and penalties). You will work in a highly collaborative environment where innovation, trust, and ownership are key values. This is a high-impact role requiring deep passion for building the platform that powers next-generation decentralised applications.


You may find yourself doing all of the following:

Design, develop, test and debug core components of the execution layer

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and deliver end-to-end functionality

Optimize performance and scalability of the execution layer for high-throughput transaction workloads

Ensure correctness, determinism, and reliability in service implementations

Drive high standards in code quality, testing, and documentation

Mentor engineers and contribute to a culture of technical excellence and open-source collaboration
jobsdetail.requirements:
Qualification Requirements:


7+ years of professional software engineering experience, including in a senior or staff-level role

Strong expertise in Java, with a deep understanding of concurrent programming and system performance

Strong grasp of computer science fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, concurrency, and design patterns

Experience building and maintaining distributed systems at scale

Experience with API design, particularly gRPC

Strong problem-solving and debugging skills

Experience in profiling and optimising complex and concurrent systems

Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Having a passion for code quality, system design, and doing things the right way

Other skills that are great to bring with you but that we can help you develop:

Experience in distributed ledger Technologies (DLT) or blockchain platforms

Exposure to security principles in distributed applications or cryptographic systems

Familiarity with web3 tools or smart contract platforms (especially EVM)

Experience with event-driven architectures or high-frequency trading systems

Description

Who We Are:

We build infrastructure that delivers massive amounts of web data to the companies training the world’s most powerful AI models.

We're the team that helps to power and support Grass, a bandwidth-sharing network that lets us operate a massive distributed crawler, giving us unique access to high-quality public web data at global scale. On top of that, we’ve built pipelines for ingesting, segmenting, and annotating billions of videos, transcripts, and audio files, powering dataset creation for frontier labs.

We’re lean, technical, and move fast. No red tape, no slow decision-making; just a team of builders pushing to expand what’s possible for open web data and AI.


The Role.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer (Backend) who is experienced and brings deep expertise in backend development. You will join a small, talented team and lead efforts to architect scalable solutions, drive technical excellence, and support our vision for a future where Grass plays a critical role in shaping the internet's evolution.

BS or MS degree in a STEM major or equivalent job experience required

4+ years experience in software development and writing very high quality code that is robust and easy to maintain

About company:

Information

http://www.gottexbrokers.com

Banking / Insurance

50 collaborators

Outreach international

Headquarters Pully, Suisse


The company

Gottex Brokers is the leading interdealer broker in interest rate derivative products across continental Europe. Based in Lausanne, Switzerland, we provide a service of excellence to our customers worldwide with particular acclaim for our Swiss Franc and Scandinavian interest rate derivatives and fixed income products.

With over 30 years of industry experience, we offer a bespoke service while maintaining the highest levels of professionalism and integrity. We have a dynamic, multinational team of experienced and highly qualified employees providing local expertise to our international client base.

As the global reference for Swiss Franc interest rate derivatives, and a dominant force in the Scandinavian markets, we offer unrivalled, customized solutions to our clients, while maintaining the highest levels of professionalism and integrity.

Our experienced and internationally diverse team serves to reinforce the strength of our brand, which has been a hallmark of the OTC derivatives business since its foundation in 1986.


Corporate culture


Excellence in execution.

We bring an outstanding and personalised service with a long-lasting commitment to our clients through a deep-rooted family culture, imbued with respect and shared values.


Note more:

Attention – Restricted Target Companies

The client has identified specific companies from which active poaching is strictly forbidden. Only passive approaches are allowed for the following institutions: Tradition, Conticap, and Starcb / banks.

Candidate Profile – Key Requirements

Experience within the Inter-Dealer Broker sector is strongly desired. Candidates must come from competitors, and active headhunting is required except for the restricted companies listed above. Banker profiles are not acceptable.

Experience in the following companies would be considered a strong advantage: Martin Brokers, Bondpartners, Bridport, Valcourt, Kepler Cheuvreux, Tullett Prebon, BGC, GFI Group, Pareto Securities AG, Aurel, BGC Freedom International Brokerage, Stifel Schweiz AG, and Louis Capital.

Flexibility and Compensation

Compensation is open to negotiation depending on the candidate’s experience and existing client portfolio. The candidate must already manage an established client book. There is flexibility on remuneration based on the seniority of the candidate and the size and quality of their client portfolio.

Administrative Constraints

The client does not accept candidates who require administrative procedures for a work permit or residence permit. Only candidates already authorized to work in the relevant location will be considered.

Position – Projects, Issues and Priorities

The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of financial markets, with a specific focus on FX Forward CHF. Long-standing and existing relationships with interbank traders are mandatory, with the ability to leverage these relationships immediately.

There is no possibility of promotion associated with this position.

Organization and Reporting Line

The team consists of six people. This role does not include any management responsibilities. The position reports directly to the Head of IRS Desk.
